intro: Licania harlingii, commonly known as the harling's licania, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, lowland areas and thrives in well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
